jparsec.io.image

Class Resize

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.io.image.Resize

  • public class Resize
extends java.lang.Object
    Advanced image/2d array resize method based on the image resize plugin at http://bigwww.epfl.ch/algorithms/ijplugins/resize/, implementing the method by A. Muñoz Barrutia, T. Blu, M. Unser, "Least-Squares Image Resizing Using Finite Differences," IEEE Transactions on Image Processing, vol. 10, no. 9, pp. 1365-1378, September 2001.

    This method should only be used (or it is only safe to be used) to reduce the size of an image.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)

      Fields

      static boolean ALLOW_RESIZE_TO_GREATER_SIZES
      This flag is by default set to false, which means that resampling an image to greater sizes will throw an error.

    • Field Detail

      • ALLOW_RESIZE_TO_GREATER_SIZES

        public static boolean ALLOW_RESIZE_TO_GREATER_SIZES
        This flag is by default set to false, which means that resampling an image to greater sizes will throw an error. You can set this to true to allow it, generally with great results, but in some cases the oversampling using this method can produce artifacts in the output image. The oversampling seems outside the aims of this method, since in the original code the default behavior was to throw the error.

    • Method Detail

      • resize

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage resize(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image,
                                  int width,
                                  int height,
                                  boolean sameRatio)
                                           throws JPARSECException
        Resizes an image.
        Parameters:
        image - The input image.
        width - The new width. Set to 0 to calculate automatically.
        height - The new height. Set to 0 to calculate automatically. Width and height cannot be both 0.
        sameRatio - True to maintain original image ratio.
        Returns:
        The output image.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • resize

        public static double[][] resize(double[][] image,
                int width,
                int height,
                boolean sameRatio)
                         throws JPARSECException
        Resizes a 2d array data [x][y].
        Parameters:
        image - The input image.
        width - The new width. Set to 0 to calculate automatically.
        height - The new height. Set to 0 to calculate automatically. Width and height cannot be both 0.
        sameRatio - True to maintain original image ratio.
        Returns:
        The output data.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

        args - Not used.
